meanings.definition: Interpret (something, especially a person's words or actions) wrongly.
meanings.sent1: I hope you don't misconstrue my silence as anger.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to misconstrue a joke as a serious comment.
meanings.sent3: Don't misconstrue my yawn during the meeting as boredom!
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was misconstrued as a sign of weakness.
meanings.sent5: Let's not misconstrue his absence as a lack of interest.

meanings.sent1: Please don't misconstrue my question as criticism.
meanings.sent2: It's common to misconstrue sarcasm in text messages.
meanings.sent3: I didn't mean to misconstrue your offer to help.
meanings.sent4: His silence was misconstrued as agreement.
meanings.sent5: Let's not misconstrue her smile as approval.
